info.title: cheqd Studio API for cheqd network
info.description: REST API service for creating and managing Decentralized Identfiers (DIDs), DID-Linked Resources (DLRs), Trust Registries, Status Lists and Verifiable Credentials.

get.description: This endpoint returns the custodian-mode client details for authenticated users.
This endpoint returns IdToken as JWT with list of user roles inside

post.summary: Create an client for an authenticated user.
post.description: This endpoint creates a client in the custodian-mode for an authenticated user

post.summary: Publish a verifiable accreditation for a DID.
post.description: Generate and publish a Verifiable Accreditation for a subject DID as a DID Linked resource.

parameters.name: accreditationType
parameters.description: Select the type of accreditation to be issued.

post.summary: Verify a verifiable accreditation for a DID.
post.description: Generate and publish a Verifiable Accreditation for a subject DID as a DID Linked resource.

parameters.name: verifyStatus
parameters.description: If set to `true` the verification will also check the status of the accreditation. Requires the VC to have a `credentialStatus` property.

parameters.name: allowDeactivatedDid
parameters.description: If set to `true` allow to verify accreditation which based on deactivated DID.

post.description: This endpoint revokes a given Verifiable Accreditation. As input, it can take the didUrl as a string. The StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList resource should already be setup in the VC and `credentialStatus` property present in the VC.

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Set whether the StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList resource should be published to the ledger or not. If set to `false`, the StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList publisher should manually publish the resource.

post.description: This endpoint suspends a given Verifiable Accreditation. As input, it can take the didUrl as a string. The StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList resource should already be setup in the VC and `credentialStatus` property present in the VC.

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Set whether the StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList resource should be published to the ledger or not. If set to `false`, the StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList publisher should manually publish the resource.

post.description: This endpoint reinstates a given Verifiable Accreditation. As input, it can take the didUrl as a string. The StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList resource should already be setup in the VC and `credentialStatus` property present in the VC.

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Set whether the StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList resource should be published to the ledger or not. If set to `false`, the StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList publisher should manually publish the resource.

get.summary: Fetch Verifiable Accreditations for DIDs associated with an account.
get.description: This endpoint returns the list of Verifiable Accreditations created by the account.

parameters.name: network
parameters.description: Filter Accreditations by the network published.

parameters.name: accreditationType
parameters.description: Select the type of accreditation to be issued.

parameters.name: did
parameters.description: Filter accreditations published by a DID

post.summary: Create an unencrypted StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList credential status list.
post.description: This endpoint creates an unencrypted StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList credential status list. The StatusList is published as a DID-Linked Resource on ledger. As input, it can can take input parameters needed to create the status list via a form, or a pre-assembled status list in JSON format. Status lists can be created as either encrypted or unencrypted.

parameters.name: listType
parameters.description: The type of Status List.

parameters.name: statusPurpose
parameters.description:
The purpose of the status list.
- For StatusList2021: Single value (revocation or suspension)
- For BitstringStatusList: Can accept multiple values as array of strings

Once this is set, it cannot be changed. A new status list must be created to change the purpose.

post.summary: Create an encrypted StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList credential status list.
post.description: This endpoint creates an encrypted StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList credential status list. The StatusList is published as a DID-Linked Resource on ledger. As input, it can can take input parameters needed to create the status list via a form, or a pre-assembled status list in JSON format. Status lists can be created as either encrypted or unencrypted.

parameters.name: listType
parameters.description: The type of Status List.

parameters.name: statusPurpose
parameters.description:
The purpose of the status list.
- For StatusList2021: Single value (revocation or suspension)
- For BitstringStatusList: Can accept multiple values as array of strings

Once this is set, it cannot be changed. A new status list must be created to change the purpose.

post.summary: Update an existing unencrypted StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList credential status list.

parameters.name: listType
parameters.description: The type of Status List.

parameters.name: statusAction
parameters.description: The update action to be performed on the unencrypted status list, can be revoke, suspend or reinstate

post.summary: Update an existing encrypted StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList credential status list.

parameters.name: listType
parameters.description: The type of Status List.

parameters.name: statusAction
parameters.description: The update action to be performed on the encrypted status list, can be revoke, suspend or reinstate

post.summary: Check a StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList index for a given Verifiable Credential.
post.description: This endpoint checks a StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList index for a given Verifiable Credential and reports whether it is revoked or suspended. It offers a standalone method for checking an index without passing the entire Verifiable Credential or Verifiable Presentation.

parameters.name: listType
parameters.description: The type of Status List.

parameters.name: statusPurpose
parameters.description: The purpose of the status list. Can be either revocation or suspension.

get.summary: Fetch StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList DID-Linked Resource based on search criteria.

parameters.name: did
parameters.description: The DID of the issuer of the status list.

parameters.name: listType
parameters.description: The type of Status List.

parameters.name: statusPurpose
parameters.description: The purpose of the status list. Can be either revocation or suspension.

parameters.name: statusListName
parameters.description: The name of the Status List DID-Linked Resource.

get.summary: List StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList DID-Linked Resources created by the customer.

parameters.name: did
parameters.description: The DID of the issuer of the status list.

parameters.name: listType
parameters.description: The type of Status List.

parameters.name: statusListName
parameters.description: The name of the Status List DID-Linked Resource.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state of the Status List DID-Linked Resource.

parameters.name: credentialCategory
parameters.description: Filter status lists by credential category assigned for.

parameters.name: deprecated
parameters.description: Filter status lists by deprecated status.

get.summary: Fetch StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList DID-Linked Resource based on search criteria.

parameters.name: statusListId
parameters.description: The statusListId of the status list.

post.description: This endpoint issues a Verifiable Credential. As input it takes the list of issuerDid, subjectDid, attributes, and other parameters of the credential to be issued.
This endpoint verifies a Verifiable Credential passed to it. As input, it can take the VC-JWT as a string or the entire credential itself.

parameters.name: verifyStatus
parameters.description: If set to `true` the verification will also check the status of the credential. Requires the VC to have a `credentialStatus` property.

parameters.name: fetchRemoteContexts
parameters.description: When dealing with JSON-LD you also MUST provide the proper contexts. Set this to `true` ONLY if you want the `@context` URLs to be fetched in case they are a custom context.

parameters.name: allowDeactivatedDid
parameters.description: If set to `true` allow to verify credential which based on deactivated DID.

post.description: This endpoint revokes a given Verifiable Credential. As input, it can take the VC-JWT as a string or the entire credential itself. The StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList resource should already be setup in the VC and `credentialStatus` property present in the VC.

parameters.name: listType
parameters.description: The type of Status List.

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Set whether the StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList resource should be published to the ledger or not. If set to `false`, the StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList publisher should manually publish the resource.

post.description: This endpoint suspends a given Verifiable Credential.  As input, it can take the VC-JWT as a string or the entire credential itself.

parameters.name: listType
parameters.description: The type of Status List.

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Set whether the StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList resource should be published to the ledger or not. If set to `false`, the StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList publisher should manually publish the resource.

post.description: Set whether the StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList resource should be published to the ledger or not. If set to `false`, the StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList publisher should manually publish the resource.

parameters.name: listType
parameters.description: The type of Status List.

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Set whether the StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList resource should be published to the ledger or not. If set to `false`, the StatusList2021 or BitstringStatusList publisher should manually publish the resource.

get.summary: List credentials issued from an associated account.
get.description: This endpoint returns the list of issued credentials controlled by the account. It provides a unified view across all providers with filtering and pagination.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number for pagination.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items per page.

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Filter credentials by provider ID (e.g., 'studio', 'dock').

parameters.name: issuerId
parameters.description: Filter credentials by issuer DID or ID.

parameters.name: subjectId
parameters.description: Filter credentials by subject DID or ID.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter credentials by status.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Filter credentials by format.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter credentials by category.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Filter credentials created before or on this date.

parameters.name: credentialType
parameters.description: Filter credentials by type (e.g., 'VerifiableCredential', 'UniversityDegreeCredential').

get.summary: Get a single issued credential by ID.
get.description: This endpoint retrieves a single issued credential using multi-strategy lookup. It can search by UUID (issuedCredentialId) or provider-specific credential ID (providerCredentialId).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Credential identifier (UUID or provider-specific ID).

parameters.name: includeCredential
parameters.description: If true, fetch and include the full credential payload from the provider.

parameters.name: syncStatus
parameters.description: If true, synchronize credential status from the provider API before returning.

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Provider hint to optimize lookup when using provider-specific credential ID.

put.description: This endpoint updates metadata for an issued credential. It allows updating providerCredentialId, status, and providerMetadata fields.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Credential identifier (issuedCredentialId).

providerCredentialId.description: Provider-specific credential ID (e.g., resource ID for studio provider).

post.description: This endpoint creates a DID and associated DID Document. As input, it can take the DID Document parameters via a form, or the fully-assembled DID Document itself.

400.description: A problem with the input fields has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

500.description: An internal error has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

post.description: This endpoint updates a DID Document. As an input, it can take JUST the sections/parameters that need to be updated in the DID Document (in this scenario, it fetches the current DID Document and applies the updated section). Alternatively, it take the fully-assembled DID Document with updated sections as well as unchanged sections.
This endpoint imports a decentralized identifier associated with the user's account for custodian-mode clients.

400.description: A problem with the input fields has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

500.description: An internal error has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

post.description: This endpoint deactivates a DID Document by taking the DID identifier as input. Must be called and signed by the DID owner.

parameters.name: did
parameters.description: DID identifier to deactivate.

get.summary: Fetch DIDs associated with an account.
get.description: This endpoint returns the list of DIDs controlled by the account.

parameters.name: network
parameters.description: Filter DID by the network published.

parameters.name: providerId
parameters.description: Filter DID by the provider.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Include metadata in response.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Filter resource by created date

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to be listed in a single page.

get.description: Resolve a DID Document by DID identifier. Also supports DID Resolution Queries as defined in the W3C DID Resolution specification.

parameters.name: did
parameters.description: DID identifier to resolve.

parameters.name: metadata
parameters.description: Return only metadata of DID Document instead of actual DID Document.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: Unique UUID version identifier of DID Document. Allows for fetching a specific version of the DID Document. See cheqd DID Method Specification for more details.

parameters.name: versionTime
parameters.description: Returns the closest version of the DID Document *at* or *before* specified time. See DID Resolution handling for `did:cheqd` for more details.

parameters.name: transformKeys
parameters.description: This directive transforms the Verification Method key format from the version in the DID Document to the specified format chosen below.

parameters.name: service
parameters.description: Query DID Document for a specific Service Endpoint by Service ID (e.g., `service-1` in `did:cheqd:mainnet:7bf81a20-633c-4cc7-bc4a-5a45801005e0#service-1`). This will typically redirect to the Service Endpoint based on DID Resolution specification algorithm.

parameters.name: relativeRef
parameters.description: Relative reference is a query fragment appended to the Service Endpoint URL. **Must** be used along with the `service` query property above. See DID Resolution specification algorithm for more details.

post.description: This endpoint exports a decentralized identifier associated with the user's account with the custodied keys.

parameters.name: did
parameters.description: DID identifier to resolve.

400.description: A problem with the input fields has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

500.description: An internal error has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

post.description: This endpoint creates an identity key pair associated with the user's account for custodian-mode clients.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Key type of the identity key pair to create.

400.description: A problem with the input fields has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

500.description: An internal error has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

post.description: This endpoint imports an identity key pair associated with the user's account for custodian-mode clients.

400.description: A problem with the input fields has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

500.description: An internal error has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

get.description: This endpoint fetches an identity key pair's details for a given key ID. Only the user account associated with the custodian-mode client can fetch the key pair.

parameters.name: kid
parameters.description: Key ID of the identity key pair to fetch.

400.description: A problem with the input fields has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

500.description: An internal error has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

get.summary: Fetch Credential event's triggered by the user.
get.description: This endpoint returns the list of Credential Events controlled by the account.

parameters.name: network
parameters.description: Filter events by the network published.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Filter events by the category.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter events by the name.

parameters.name: deprecated
parameters.description: Filter events by the deprecated type

parameters.name: successful
parameters.description: Filter events by the status

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Filter resource by created date

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to be listed in a single page.

post.summary: !!! WARN. Such endpoint is made mostly for testing purposes and it is not supposed to be used in production !!! Create a Verifiable Presentation from credential(s).
post.description:
This endpoint creates a Verifiable Presentation from credential(s). As input, it can take the credential(s) as a string or the entire credential(s) itself. 
 !!! WARN. Such endpoint is made only for testing purposes !!!

post.summary: Verify a Verifiable Presentation generated from credential(s).
post.description: This endpoint verifies the Verifiable Presentation generated from credential(s). As input, it can take the Verifiable Presentation JWT as a string or the entire Verifiable Presentation itself.

parameters.name: verifyStatus
parameters.description: If set to `true` the verification will also check the status of the presentation. Requires the VP to have a `credentialStatus` property.

parameters.name: fetchRemoteContexts
parameters.description: When dealing with JSON-LD you also MUST provide the proper contexts. * Set this to `true` ONLY if you want the `@context` URLs to be fetched in case they are a custom context.

parameters.name: allowDeactivatedDid
parameters.description: If set to `true` allow to verify credential which based on deactivated DID.

get.description: Returns list of available credential providers
Returns list of providers activated by the customer

post.summary: Activate a provider for the customer
Import a DID into a Provider.
post.description: This endpoint imports a decentralized identifier associated with the user's account with the custodied keys into a provider.

400.description: A problem with the input fields has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

500.description: An internal error has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

post.description: This endpoint creates a DID-Linked Resource. As input, it can take the DID identifier and the resource parameters via a form, or the fully-assembled resource itself.

parameters.name: did
parameters.description: DID identifier to link the resource to.

get.description: This endpoint returns the DID-Linked Resource for a given DID identifier and resource identifier.

parameters.name: did
parameters.description: DID identifier

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: Fetch a DID-Linked Resource by Resource ID unique identifier. Since this is a unique identifier, other Resource query parameters are not required. See DID-Linked Resources for more details.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: Filter a DID-Linked Resource query by Resource Name. See DID-Linked Resources for more details.

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description: Filter a DID-Linked Resource query by Resource Type. See DID-Linked Resources for more details.

parameters.name: resourceVersion
parameters.description: Filter a DID-Linked Resource query by Resource Version, which is an optional free-text field used by issuers (e.g., "v1", "Final Version", "1st January 1970" etc). See DID-Linked Resources for more details.

parameters.name: resourceVersionTime
parameters.description: Filter a DID-Linked Resource query which returns the closest version of the Resource *at* or *before* specified time. See DID-Linked Resources for more details.

parameters.name: checksum
parameters.description: Request integrity check against a given DID-Linked Resource by providing a SHA-256 checksum hash. See DID-Linked Resources for more details.

parameters.name: resourceMetadata
parameters.description: Return only metadata of DID-Linked Resource instead of actual DID-Linked Resource. Mutually exclusive with some of the other parameters.

get.summary: Fetch Resources created by the user.
get.description: This endpoint returns the list of DID Linked Resources controlled by the account.

parameters.name: network
parameters.description: Filter resources by the network published.

parameters.name: resourceName
parameters.description: Filter resources by the resource name

parameters.name: resourceType
parameters.description: Filter resources by the resource type

parameters.name: did
parameters.description: Filter resources published by a DID

parameters.name: encrypted
parameters.description: Filter resource by encryption type

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Filter resource by created date

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Page number.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to be listed in a single page.
